definition[0]: to hang or bend down, or to make something do this
example[0]: The plant needs some water – it’s starting to droop.
example[1]: His eyelids began to droop  (=close, because he was sleepy).
example[3]: Our spirits drooped as we faced the long trip home.
definition[2]: if prices, sales etc droop, they start to fall
example[4]: In Tokyo, share prices drooped during the Emperor’s illness.
